title: Housing Specialist
description:
Who is Bridging Access to Care, Inc.: Bridging Access to Care, Inc. (BAC) is a nonprofit, multi-service, community-based behavioral health care organization committed to building healthy communities, one person at a time.

In 2012, Brooklyn Aids Task Force changed its name to BAC and successfully made the transition from an AIDS-centered organization to a multi-service community-based healthcare organization. Brooklyn Aids Task Force was the very first HIV/AIDS organization in Brooklyn prioritizing serving persons living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA) since 1986. Today, BAC provides mental health and substance use-related social services, comprehensive HIV/AIDS care, and coordinated health care and supportive services to under-served racial and ethnic minority communities in the Brooklyn and other parts of New York City.

Bridging Access to Care, Inc. offers a competitive salary package, including health insurance, retirement plan, paid time off, and opportunities for professional development.

**JOB SUMMARY:** The Housing Specialist plays a key role in the outreach and recruitment of individuals for the Flatbush Gardens program. This position focuses on providing housing placement assistance to help vulnerable participants secure stable housing. The specialist will actively engage and enroll participants in available housing resources, offering coordination and linkage to ensure they obtain permanent housing.

**Education and Qualification:** 

· Minimum Associates Degree Required

· Bachelor's Degree Preferred

· Minimum (2) two years of successful placement, experience working with underserved and at-risk population

· Minimum (2) two years’ experience assisting hard-to-place individuals and families, computer skills and professional development,

· Minimum (2) two years’ experience leading workshops and outreach. Portfolio of brokers, rental management entities, community organizations.

**Bilingual/ Second Language:** Haitian Creole and/or Spanish Preferred. Must be able to read, write, speak, and comprehend Haitian Creole and/or Spanish and English.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:** 

**Housing Placement and Support**

· Assist clients in locating and securing appropriate housing, including for their families if necessary.

· Compile a directory of landlords and brokers, establishing relationships to facilitate housing placements.

· Ensure clients are prepared for the housing process by coordinating mock interviews, group sessions, and accompanying clients to housing interviews.

· Work with brokers and realtors to identify appropriately sized apartment units within acceptable rent guidelines.

· Arrange apartment viewings, negotiate leases, and ensure apartments comply with HUD habitability standards.

· Assist clients in setting up utility services (electricity, phone) and securing furniture and furnishings.

· Serve as a liaison between clients and landlords to resolve rent and apartment maintenance issues.

**Outreach and Engagement**

· Conduct outreach to external agencies and stakeholders to engage the focus population in Flatbush Garden housing complex services through both telephone and in-person outreach.

· Engage and enroll participants in all available housing resources, linkages, and programs.

**Client Intake and Assessment**

· Conduct intakes, assessments, reassessments, and develop service plans tailored to individual client needs.

· Monitor clients' medical compliance and facilitate case conferences with collateral providers.

**Client Transition and Support**

· Assist clients in moving from their current residence into new apartments by coordinating necessary moving assistance.

· Use motivational interviewing techniques and contingency management to support clients in achieving housing milestones.

**Documentation and Compliance**

· Ensure all service deliverables are met and track service delivery progress.

· Document all services within 24 hours of delivery.

· Track referrals and complete 2010e applications, making referrals based on letters of determination.

· Maintain records on interview results and housing placements and make recommendations for process improvements.

**Additional Duties**

· Perform other related duties as required to support the success of the housing program.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:** 

· Substance abuse, homelessness, motivational interviewing, mental health conditions

· Excellent interpersonal and problem-solving skills

· Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite programs including Word, Excel, Outlook, and Microsoft Teams

· Preferred experience with HRA 2010e, databases, Electronic Health Records, CARES or similar

(Flatbush Gardens)

description:
Sunrise Detox:  

Position Title: Behavioral Health Technician  

  

Sunrise Detox is a premiere center for drug and alcohol detox. Sunrise promises to give you one of the most comfortable medical detox processes available. We believe in creating a different experience where our road to recovery is dignified. Our clients reside in comfortable modern, elegantly furnished rooms where good nutrition is also an essential part of the detoxification process. We offer individual and group counseling to clients and bring in 12 Step meetings to show clients they are not alone once they leave treatment.  

  

Behavioral Health Technician Job description:  

The Behavioral Health Technician is an integral member of the team with extensive patient contact. They provide communication between the patients, medical staff and clinicians. Excellent patient care includes preparation of charts for case management, assisting the medical staff with vitals and ensuring patient needs are met in a timely and proficient manner.  

  

Behavioral Health Technician Duties/Responsibilities:  

* Completion of intakes on new patient admissions, orientation procedures and schedules
* Document attendance for all groups
* Recording inventory log of patient’s personal belongings and valuables
* Interact appropriately with patients and staff, using deescalating skills when necessary

  

Behavioral Health Technician Requirements:  

* High School Diploma or GED
* Knowledge of addiction and mental health a plus
* Experience with Microsoft office products

title: Psychologist
description:
We are currently seeking a Psychologist to join our esteemed institution at our Montefiore UBA-WeCARE Program. WeCARE provides a continuum of services to help HRA referred cash assistance clients with medical and/or mental health conditions that affect their employability to attain their maximum levels of self-sufficiency. Individuals referred to WeCARE receive medical and psychosocial assessments to identify possible clinical conditions and social barriers that may affect their ability to participate in work-related activities. Based on the results of the assessments, a determination of an individual's functional capacity (FCO) is made and a customized service plan by our team is developed to provide a range of services tailored to meet a client's particular needs. An individual will be referred for a psychiatric assessment performed by an psychologist only in certain circumstances, such as when a client disagrees with a functional capacity outcome (FCO) determination or when an FCO cannot be determined from the assessment or if possible mental health barriers to employment are present. The psychologist will function independently with physician oversight.

Job Duties:

- Review prior WeCARE documentation and that provided by the client, the Clinical Assessment, Medical Evaluation, and Substance Use Assessment (when indicated)

- Obtain a psychiatric and substance use history

- Conduct a mental status examination

- Update the psychiatric limitations

- Elaborate on the reported findings, identify issues not previously reported and explain any inconsistencies between the interpretation of clinical information

- Provide reasonable accommodations and/or work restrictions, as necessary

- Assess potential eligibility for federal disability benefits using the SSA sequential evaluation process

- Make a determination of the functional capacity outcome and provide a written rationale for the decision

- Participate in team meetings to evaluate and improve the WeCARE process

- Handles psychiatric emergencies/urgencies among WeCARE clients in the office

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $105,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year

title: Assistant Manager, Digital Media
description:
Location:
New York, NY, US
Team: Digital
Job type: Permanent
Puig is a major player in the worldwide fashion and beauty industry. We have a wide portfolio of well-known luxury brands across fashion, fragrance, makeup, skincare, and wellness. Founded more than 100 years ago, Puig is a family-owned company with a long-term commitment to our brands and stakeholders.


**The Opportunity**
-------------------



The role will be responsible for supporting all US digital and social heavy paid media execution in partnership with our agency team and global brand teams. This role will also support on all PR/Influencer event execution while partnering closely with the PR & Influencer team. The assistant manager will develop strong relationships with key beauty media and agencies while partnering internally and externally to support our digital and social media for our US brands.  



**What you'll get to do**
-------------------------



Digital Marketing Execution:


* Design in partnership with manager, internal teams, and agencies, Puig brands’ go to market strategies
* Leveraging consumer data and insights, and have an eye for cohesive planning across Paid, Owned, and Earned media channels
* Collaborate with Brand Management teams and Global teams to ensure brand equity and storytelling is consistent, while developing plans to perform based on local needs
* Work to deliver best in class market campaign execution, reporting and analytics
* Strong collaboration with other departments (Brand Management, Media, E-commerce) to drive overall business needs and keeping teams up to speed on support that can be expected


Media:


* Develop omni-channel media plans and lead execution of creative assets in partnership with global teams and agencies
* Understanding of all media channels from traditional (OOH, TV, Print) to digital (CTV/OLV, display, mobile, programmatic) to social/emerging channels (Meta, Snap, Pinterest, Google/YouTube, TikTok)
* Experience with retailer specific media a plus (Macy’s Media Network, Ulta Beauty Media, Sephora Retailer Network, Nordstrom Media Network, Bloomingdale’s Media Network, etc)
* Work hand in hand with the media agency on objectives and KPIs and challenge them on improving digital media efficiency
* Handle all campaign creative planning and trafficking in partnership with agencies
* Carry out post campaign analysis with the help of the Media Agency to measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns, and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs)
* Financial planning, budget maintenance and allocation of funds across multi-media platforms.
* Oversight and creation of all media PO’s and invoice reconciliation


Content & Events:


* Support content strategies; identification and request of specific local content needed (including the local retailers’ partners), alignment with marketing goals, to Global Brands teams, challenging them with new ideas to implement the local digital strategy in partnership with your manager
* Partnership and event support with the PR/Influencer teams for VIP launch events, masterclasses, etc
**We'd love to meet you if you have**
-------------------------------------


* Bachelor’s Degree (preferred)
* Minimum 3-4 Years of Digital Marketing experience
* Digital Media Agency experience (highly preferred)
* Demonstrated track record for executing 360 plans across Paid, Owned and Earned channels
* Strong understanding of media data/research sources
* Track record of building brand awareness with an eye for message, content and stories
* Significant experience and a proven track record of executing digital media campaigns
* Understanding of the Digital Media landscape, KPIs and leading digital partners
* Strong verbal skills, innovative thinker, and interested in first to market
* Highly proficient in Microsoft Word, Powerpoint, and Excel
* Needs to be a creative problem solver, thrive in fast paced environment, prioritize and oversee multiple projects at once
* Strong attention to detail and work well with cross functional teams
* Positive attitude and demonstrates a high level of maturity and presence
**Compensation Data**
---------------------



As required by New York State's salary transparency law, effective November 2022, the expected base salary for this position ranges from $75,000.00 - $85,000.00. Various factors are considered when extending offers, such as relevant skillset, training, years of experience related to the current job description, education, and our organizational structure. In addition to the base salary, PUIG offers a competitive benefits package that includes health and dental insurance, life insurance, disability insurance, 401K, paid holidays, a generous paid time-off policy, hybrid work environment, and career opportunities within a dynamic team.


**A few things you'll love about us**
-------------------------------------


* An entrepreneurial, creative and welcoming work culture
* A range of learning and development opportunities

title: Chief of Staff, Global Media
description:
**Company Description**  

Publicis Groupe, known for its award-winning creativity, best-in-class technology, digital and consulting expertise, is the world's third largest communications group. With 80,000+ colleagues in over 100 countries, the Groupe has four Solution hubs: Creative with Publicis Communications, Media with Publicis Media, Digital business transformation with Publicis.Sapient, and Health & Wellbeing with Publicis Health.


Since 2014 with the acquisition of Sapient, Publicis Groupe has undergone a profound transformation by scaling a new model connecting data, creativity, and technology. The Groupe has continued this journey with the 2019 acquisition of Epsilon to further scale the data-led offering and provide true momentum to our client's own transformation.


This model, with a country-led approach, is called the "Power of One" and gathers all the capabilities of the Groupe under one roof, putting clients at the core of the organization.

 **Job Description**  

The Cheief of Staff, Global Media is an accomplished, strategic operator, adept at driving initiative progress through matrixed organizations by thoughtful program and stakeholder orchestration. You will:

* Leading strategic and tactical project orchestration from discovery to delivery
* Partnering across the company to design solutions for clients and new business processes
* Using direct experience with Global media accounts and Agile project management to drive progress
* Maintaining up-to-date data and materials tailored to client needs
* Understanding the media and technology vertical and various businesses
* Reporting into the Chief Solutions Officer
* Driving progress in solution design across teams
* Providing purpose, direction, and motivation to the team
* Owning communications with clients and internal stakeholders
* Maintaining progress tracking and setting quality standards
* Acting as the day-to-day project contact for clients and stakeholders
* Managing third-party partner and vendor relationships as needed

  

**Qualifications**  

* Relationship-building and collaboration with key client stakeholders
* Documentation and workflow expertise across business units
* Global media and Martech/Adtech ecosystem knowledge
* Awareness of industry trends and client solution opportunities
* Experience with co-located and virtual teams
* BA/BS in Business, Economics, or Strategy-related discipline
* 5+ years of experience in marketing, media agencies, or related fields
* Located in the New York tri-state area with some travel required (10-15%)
* Experience working with senior leaders and management
* Skilled in solving market and project management challenges

  

**Additional Information**  

Our Publicis Groupe motto "Viva La Différence" means we're better together, and we believe that our differences make us stronger. It means we honor and celebrate all identities, across all facets of intersectionality, and it underpins all that we do as an organization. We are focused on fostering belonging and creating equitable & inclusive experiences for all talent.


Compensation Range: $70,000-117,500. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time.


The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 08/6/2024.


Publicis Groupe provides robust and inclusive benefit programs and policies to support the evolving and diverse needs of our talent and enable every person to grow and thrive. Our benefits package includes medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401K, as well as parental and family care leave, family forming assistance, tuition reimbursement, and flexible time off.


If you require accommodation or assistance with the application or onboarding process specifically, please contact hrcompliance\\_usms@publicis.com.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Veterans Encouraged to Apply

title: General Manager
description:
**Job description**

**Job Posting: General Manager**

**Overview:** Apply your leadership skills and passion for creating memorable experiences as a General Manager at our hotel! You will play a crucial role in sustaining our values and culture, supporting, guiding, and mentoring your hotel team. By leading by example, you will champion personalized service for our guests, resulting in exceptional financial performance for our owners.

**We Offer:**

* **Group Insurance:** Medical, dental, vision, and company-paid life insurance
* **Paid Time Off:** Generous time off to support work-life balance
* **401(k) Plan:** Company-matched contributions to help secure your future
* **Voluntary Benefits:** Short-term and long-term disability, accident insurance, life insurance, critical illness coverage, and Flexible Spending Account options
* **Life Enrichment Benefits:** Hotel benefits, employee assistance program, leadership development program, and more!
* **Daily Pay:** Get paid daily to manage your finances better

**Responsibilities:**

* Interview, hire, train, support, coach, and mentor department managers and their teams.
* Champion excellent service and empower your staff to exceed guest expectations.
* Cultivate strong relationships with guests to develop loyalty and maintain high satisfaction levels.
* Apply problem-solving skills to resolve guest and employee issues effectively.
* Monitor daily operations to ensure adherence to standard operating procedures.
* Assist with benefits administration, payroll, and other HR tasks, including employee recognition and celebrations.
* Support and contribute to proactive sales efforts alongside the sales team.
* Communicate and enforce emergency procedures as needed.
* Conduct property inspections to ensure a clean, safe, and secure environment.
* Plan for success and improvement through staff meetings, action plans, and daily huddles.
* Strategize with Revenue Management to maximize revenue and grow market share.
* Prepare various financial reports for management and owners.

**Qualifications:**

* At least 3 years of progressive experience in a Marriott Select Service hotel required; a four-year college degree and at least 3 years of related experience preferred.
* Physical ability to exert up to 20 pounds of force occasionally and/or up to 10 pounds of force frequently.
* Maintain a warm and friendly demeanor at all times.
* Effective verbal and written communication skills with employees and guests.
* Ability to listen, understand, and address concerns raised by employees and guests.
* Strong multitasking and prioritization skills to meet departmental deadlines.
* Attentive, friendly, courteous, and service-oriented approach in all interactions.
* Attendance at all hotel-required meetings and training sessions.
* Participation in Manager on Duty (M.O.D.) coverage as required.
* High standards of personal appearance and grooming, including wearing nametags.
* Compliance with company standards and regulations for safe and efficient operations.
* Effective problem-solving skills, including anticipation, prevention, identification, and resolution.
* Ability to understand and evaluate complex information and data from various sources.
* Commitment to maintaining confidentiality.
* Perform other duties as requested by management.

**Salary Range:** Commensurate with experience.

Join us and make a significant impact on our hotel’s success and guest satisfaction. Apply today!

title: Medical Assistant/Receptionist
description:
The Medical Assistant (MA) is a multi-skilled health professional who works collaboratively on a dynamic multidisciplinary team to provide a wide range of duties and responsibilities in a manner that places an emphasis on quality of care and customer service. Under the direction of the Primary Care Provider, Clinical Practice Manager and Office Supervisor, the MA participates in team-based care by assisting with structuring the patient flow, providing direct and in-direct patient care, assisting with procedures and clerical duties. He/She will add value to care team through coordinated, efficient, and effective collaboration with patient, family and care team. The Medical Assistant will be motivated, energetic, and an empathetic communicator who is passionate about delivering the highest quality of care. This opportunity offers an excellent salary, great benefits as well as the ability to be part of a physician-led, patient-centric network committed to simplifying the complexities of health care and bringing a more connected kind of care.

**Essential Job functions:**

* Prepares the examination room. Escorts patient into the room. Cleans examination room when exam is complete.
* Maintains efficient patient flow.
* Monitors Providers schedule for additions/cancellations
* Properly utilizes Athena to alert Provider when patient ready
* Ensures proper preparation for patient visit. Prepares pertinent information needed for patient visit.
* Chart Prep: Prepare patient visit in advance
* Perform patient outreach to obtain vaccine records and imaging results
* Queue up orders as appropriate for visit
* Review outstanding orders/referrals
* Communicates & provides care consistent with age, cultural, spiritual and developmental needs of the patient.
* Answers the telephone in an appropriate manner. Directs calls and/or takes accurate messages.
* Perform Patient check-in/check-out when applicable
* Schedule’s appointments accurately and appropriately according to departmental guidelines.
* Consistently and accurately stocks examination rooms with all necessary supplies.
* Assists in ordering and maintaining of all supplies as assigned.
* Reconciles encounters daily and accurately, according to policy guidelines.
* Effectively communicates problems, concerns, or issues to the Supervisor and/or Manager appropriately and promptly.
* Understands and performs within scope of practice.
* Obtains vital signs: BP, temp, pulse, height & weight accurately and completely as required. Documents appropriately in EHR.
* Reviews and updates medication list and accurately documents known allergies in the Electronic Health Record (EHR). Demonstrates an understanding of prescription control and prescription refill procedures.
* Accurately documents allergies in EHR.
* Accurately documents family, medical, social history
* Performs medication reconciliation
* Performs preventative screenings (PHQ2/9, STEADI Falls Risk, CAGE screenings)
* Employs appropriate and timely use of Tasking in EHR.
* Maintains Provider Staff Clinical Inbox
* Appropriately enters orders and schedules appointments in the Practice Management System (PMS) and EHR.
* Provides referrals and/or consult orders appropriately and in a timely manner in the PMS and EHR.
* Appropriately adheres to universal safety precautions when administering medications and disposal of medical waste.
* Maintains proficiency with department specific equipment, troubleshoots and reports malfunctions promptly
* Facilitates transition of care to UCC/Hospital
* Demonstrates flexibility with various work schedules and office locations.
* Administers approved vaccinations
* Performs point of care testing including but not limited to: Urine Dips/pregnancy, Hemocue, nasal swabs for flu/covid, throat cultures
* Performs phlebotomy as applicable
* All other duties as assigned
* Perform patient outreach: AWV’s, Gardasil/Pneumonia, Chronic Care Visits
* Actively participate in pilot programs
* Recognizes and performs duties which need to be performed although not directly assigned.
* Other duties as assigned

**Physical Job Requirements:**

* Physical mobility, which includes movement from place to place on the job, taking distance and speed into account.
* Physical agility, which includes ability to maneuver body while in place.
* Dexterity of hands and fingers.
* Endurance (e.g. continuous typing, prolonged standing/bending, walking).

**Environmental Risks:**

* Allergens: dust, mold and/or pollen
* Combative Patients / Visitors

**Education, Certification, Computer and Training Requirements:**

* High School Graduate/GED / Equivalent Work or Vocational / Technical School / Diploma, required. Associate Degree’s preferred.
* 0-1 year related work experience, required. 2-4 years related work experience, preferred.
* Medical Assistant certification, required
* Basic Life Support (BLS) or within 30 days of hire, required
* Ability to communicate in English, both orally and in writing, required
* Ability to organize and perform multiple tasks in a timely manner, required
* Basic proficiency in computer use, required
* Ability to commute to satellite offices as needed, required

**Travel:**

* Travel to satellite locations as needed

title: Supervisor (Operations), Substation Operations, Northern Operations, Manhattan South
description:
**Overview**


Substation Operations (Northern Operations) is seeking a highly motivated and dedicated individual that possesses a high regard for personal accountability and understands the importance of commitment to excellence. The successful candidate must demonstrate a high energy level and promote a positive work ethic in support of our corporate values as well as provide strong customer support.**Responsibilities**


**Core Responsibilities*** Supervises Operators (Senior Substation Operators, Assistant Substation Operators, GUWs, etc) a majority of the time in the operation of substation equipment. As needed, will supervise mechanics, engineering inspectors and subordinate titled personnel in the maintenance, construction, repair and inspection of substations and associated substation equipment and structures. Orders, coordinates and ensures availability and timely delivery of materials, supplies and equipment.
* Will interface with various Con Edison departments and personnel who enter our substations (i.e.-Electric Operations, Transmission Operations, Central Engineering, etc.).
* Ensures that the operation, maintenance, repair and inspection of transmission and area substations equipment and structures are performed in compliance with operating procedures.
* Attend the daily management meetings to report job progress, be fully knowledgeable of work scopes and submit Work Permit Requests in a clear and concise manner.
* Work with the Field Planners and Central Planning group to improve work plans and provide feedback to planners on work plans.
* Certifies accounts for and approves expenditures for labor, material supplies and equipment within prescribed limits.
* Ensures personnel comply with all company and departmental rules and regulations. In addition, ensures that all work functions in the substations are in compliance with safety procedures, OSHA laws and general environmental instructions.
* Initiates preliminary accident investigations and submits reports.
* Investigates substation abnormalities, equipment status, and job status within the substations.
* Conducts environmental, health and safety lectures.
* Plans, organizes, schedules and assigns personnel to meet operating and climatic conditions to optimize productivity.
* Orders, coordinates, and ensures availability and timely delivery of materials, supplies and equipment. Certifies, accounts for and approves expenditures for labor, material, petty cash, supplies, and equipment within prescribed limits.
* Enforces good housekeeping practices for equipment and work areas. Ensures safety in work procedures, job setups, and job briefings.
* Ensures station compliance items and equipment PM's are performed on time as per department procedures and specifications.
* Will supervise field personnel in work activities, coach, schedule, train, and have appropriate safety discussions.
* Must be committed to fostering a Zero Accident Culture, Diversity and Inclusion, Achieving Operational Excellence, Developing an Effective Cost Management Culture and Enhancing the Customers Experience.
* Enforces Company procedures, e.g. Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO), Substance Abuse, Discipline and Security.
* Must be committed to the Way We Work Principles, adherence to the Companys Standards of Business Conduct and other Company procedures including Environmental, Health and Safety (EH&S).
* Will ensure that all personnel, tools and material are safely and effectively utilized and the use of Human Performance Improvement (HPI) tools is incorporated in daily activities.
* Committed to fostering an environment where employees understand their purpose, feel valued and are collectively aligned towards making improvements across the organization.
* Ensure that all Environmental, Health and Safety (EH&S) work practices are followed and work is done in accordance with Company policy and governmental regulations.
* The supervisor is also responsible for conducting On the Job training (OJT), effective job briefings and documented job site safety exchanges.
* Enforce all contractual and local work rules; assign personnel to jobs in accordance with the Weekly Work Schedule and adhering to the station schedule.
* Must be able to perform other related tasks and assignments as required.
* Perform other related tasks and assignments as required.

**Qualifications**


**Required Education/Experience*** Bachelor's Degree and 2 years related work experience 2 years of experience in operations, maintenance or construction of power generation, transmission or distribution equipment or equivalent education/experience is required. or
* Associate's Degree and 4 years related work experience 3-4 years of experience in operations, maintenance or construction of power generation, transmission or distribution equipment or
* High School Diploma/GED and 5 years related work experience 5 years of experience or more in operations, maintenance or construction of power generation, transmission or distribution equipment.
* Additional:


**Relevant Work Experience*** Work experience in the operation, maintenance, or construction of power generation, transmission, and distribution equipment Required
* Computer Skills including Microsoft Office programs, Maximo/DataSplice, Engage/ePlan Required
* Exercise independent judgement and able to render sound business decisions Required
* Be detailed oriented, able to work under pressure and handle multiple concurrent assignments Required
* Strong oral and written communications skills, good presentation skills and ability to effectively interact with both internal and external customers, support staff, and various levels of management and union Required
* Must have strong oral and written communication skills, good presentation skills and the ability to effectively interact with both internal and external customers, support staff, and various levels of management Required
* Must be computer literate and be able to apply practical applications in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and work management systems such as Maximo, Engage and OSS Required
* Supervisory experience Preferred
* Technical experience or working knowledge in the operation, maintenance, construction, inspection, and repair of the electrical transmission and distribution system to include: substation operations, switchgear installation, grounding practices, circuit breaker mechanics, and electrical distribution transformers Preferred


**Licenses And Certfications*** Driver's License Required
* Other: NYC S-95 certification 1 Year Required
* Other: NYC S-12 certification 1 Year Required


**Physical Demands*** Must respond to system emergencies
* Must work at field locations in all weather conditions
* Must perform extended driving through heavy traffic and severe off-road conditions
* Must carry tools and materials, climb ladders and scaffolds, and enter confined spaces
* Must work in, under, and on top of all types of company vehicles/equipment
* Must work in an environment that includes heat, noise, confined spaces, and high elevations
* Must climb ladders and stairs
* Must work on elevated platforms, scaffolds, catwalks, roofs, or equipment
* Must work in inclement weather and adverse conditions (i.e., excessive heat, cold, noise, confined spaces)

* Must be approved and able to wear a full- or half-face respirator and self-contained breathing apparatus (SCBA), without facial hair or other condition that may interfere with the seal, in accordance with OSHA regulations.
* Must climb in and out of manholes and excavations

* Must use hand tools and operate heavy equipment,i.e. jackhammers
* Must travel to company locations to work on storm restoration and heat contingencies
* Must use eye-hand coordination to adjust controls on equipment
* Must wear all necessary personal Protective Equipment (PPE), including; fire retardant clothing and safety harness
* Must work rotating shifts, including nights, midnights, weekends, and holidays
* Must use their personal vehicles and transport, store, and secure company laptop computers and other job related equipment in the vehicle. Reimbursement for use of personal vehicle is available through the company mileage procedure.


**Additional Physical Demands*** Must be able to respond to Company emergencies by performing a System Emergency Assignment to restore service to our customers.

title: Dock Worker/Yard Jockey
description:
**JOB TITLE: Dock Worker / yard Jockey**

**Must have jockey experience**

**Full-time - 2:30pm Start time**

**Full Benefits including 401k and company-paid healthcare**

REPORTS TO: Dock Supervisor

OVERVIEW OF ROLE: To ensure the customer is always serviced first by providing efficient and safe, claim-free handling of freight. To exemplify Ward's Pallet Expertise when loading, unloading, sorting and handling freight by hand and/or using material handling equipment such as forklifts, carts, etc. Properly load/unload freight and correctly complete all required paperwork.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Load and unload freight under the direction of the lead dock worker or dock supervisor.
* Strip trailers and move freight using appropriate freight handling equipment to appropriate trailers to be loaded according to specifications on manifests or other paperwork.
* Correctly complete all required paperwork (stripping manifest, stacking report, road manifest, delivery loading report).
* Plan the loading of freight into trailers to fully utilize available space and minimize risk of damage. Ensure stack racks are correctly used in appropriate lanes and ensure shipment integrity in support of our Pallet Expertise and the Stack Up Loading System.
* Properly perform tasks to assure safety and to prevent damage to cargo. Secure load to prevent shifting, falling and damage to the freight using stack bars, stretch wrap, stack rings and rope, dunnage and cardboard.
* Count and inspect all shipments and make appropriate notations on manifests for any exception (overage, shortage, damage).
* Promptly report any O S & D problems or improper loading using the damage load report. Apply appropriate O S & D labels to freight when loading.
* Use forklift in a safe and appropriate manner.
* Perform work in a safe, efficient manner.
* Meet established productivity goals.
* Learn about Hazardous Materials and handle them in a safe, correct manner in accordance with training received.
* Provide constant feedback to Operations Manager or supervisor on specific freight handling characteristics in support of Ward's CBS system.
* Actively participate in driver/dock meetings providing managers with feedback on customers and work processes. Work to understand and support targeted growth plans. Read internal newsletters such as the Inside Lane and Driving Force to stay abreast of what's happening within the company.
* Fully support all technologies and processes, introduced by Ward, that are intended to improve efficiencies and/or the customer experience. Support would include adherence to training programs, guidelines and processes associated with these systems.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* Must be able to read and write, complete company and governmental forms, and understand written company policies and governmental regulations.
* Must be able to understand and complete forms necessary to the movement of freight in the industry; for example, road manifests, freight bills, hazardous material labels, etc.
* Must have a working knowledge of or the ability to acquire knowledge of the procedures necessary to perform all aspects of freight handling in a safe and efficient manner, including properly planning and loading trailers.
* Experience in forklift operation preferred.
* Must be able to work the required hours.
* Must wear steel-toed shoes/boots.
* Must participate in random drug testing of all non-DOT employees.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

* Must be able to successfully pass a post offer physical agility test, specifically designed for the tasks associated with the position. The physical demands for this position are "Heavy", as defined by the Dictionary of Occupational Titles: Exerting 50 to 100 lb of force occasionally, and/or 25 to 50 lb of force frequently, and/or 10 to 20 lb of force constantly to move objects, physical demand requirements are in excess of those for medium work.
* Specific physical demands include, but are not limited to:

- Carrying: Occasional, up to 75 lbs., up to 40 feet  
- Pushing: Occasional, up to 600 lbs., up to 100 feet  
- Pulling: Occasional, up to 600 lbs., up to 100 feet  
- Lifting - Floor to Knee, Knee to Waist, Waist to Shoulder: Occasional, up to 75 lbs.  
- Stooping, Twisting, Balancing, Bending, Climbing, Crouching, Kneeling,Standing:  
Occasional  
- Sitting: Frequent

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Yard jockey: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Sales Representative
description:
**Gallo Privacy Policy**

**Why Gallo?**


With a global portfolio of over 100 unique wine and spirits brands, we are the largest family-owned winery in the world. Apply Today! **Our Brands. Your Future.**


**Summary**


By incorporating the attributes of self-confidence, enthusiasm, product knowledge, creativity, and common sense, represents all distributor products to Retail establishments.

 **What You Will Do:**

* Conducts distributor business in an assigned territory containing in such a way that an appropriate sales volume will be achieved.
* Conducts tastings at customer locations.
* Through the use of business builders and trackers, pre-plans each call for maximum effectiveness.
* Gains knowledge of competitive sales trends and pricing in order to maintain specific pricing structures on all Gallo products.
* Knows the sales trends in each account, understands the business strategies and practices of each decision maker.
* Knowledge of products, promotional and merchandising programs to achieve and maintain 100% distribution achievement in every account.
* Demonstrates entrepreneurial spirit.
* Listens carefully to needs and preferences of retail decision makers.
* Uses data facts and figures, IRI, etc. to correctly make persuasive sales presentations.
* Overcomes objections raised during a sales presentation.
* Provides guidance to Merchandisers assigned to merchandise specific store shelves, cold box, and floor displays approved by store management.
* Merchandises products through use of Point of Sale materials, cold box and shelf management, and creative mass display to stimulate impulse sales.
* Provides continuing and conscientious service to each account by managing accounts receivable, inventory, rotating display product, cold box product, and shelf stock when necessary
* Maintains up to date route cards and account records.
* Uses pocket PCs for storing and downloading customer order, and reporting sales information.
* Provides management with accurate daily sales reports and display trackings.
* Complies with all the distributor policies and procedures.
* Effectively handles special in-store problems and reporting that might occur from time to time.
* Projects a professional appearance while being resourceful, friendly and persistent with retail decision makers.
* Maintains a cooperative attitude with management and provides reports that are accurate and on time.
* Practices safe work and driving habits and, if accountable for others, ensures their understanding and compliance of such habits.
* Maintains satisfactory attendance, to include timeliness.
* Responsible for understanding and complying with applicable quality, environmental and safety regulatory considerations. If accountable for the work of others, responsible for ensuring their understanding and compliance.

 **Supervisory Responsibilities**

* N/A

 **What You Will Need:**

* Bachelor's degree; OR Senior class standing at a college or university and a Bachelor's degree is successfully completed and confirmed by the time of hire OR High school diploma or State-issued equivalency certificate plus 4 years of sales experience reflecting increasing levels of responsibility; OR High school diploma or State-issued equivalency certificate plus 1 year of Gallo or affiliated or non-affiliated distributor merchandising or sales experience.
* Must be 21 years of age or older.
* Required to obtain a solicitor's permit as required by state/locality.
* Required to travel by automobile to perform job duties.
* Candidates for this position must have a valid driver’s license and safe driving record.
* Required to obtain a New Jersey driver’s license or appropriate state driver’s license within 30 days of hire.
* Required to lift and move cases of product that weighs up to 60 pounds including lifting overhead.
* Required to work weekends for special functions/events when necessary.

 **What Will Set You Apart:**

* Bachelor’s degree plus 2 years retail sales experience or 2 years wine sales experience.
* Skilled in demonstrating teamwork and leadership.
* Experienced in reading and comprehending simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos.
* Experienced in writing simple correspondence.
* Experienced in effectively presenting information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.
* Skilled in defining problems, collecting data, establishing facts, and drawing valid conclusions. Experienced in planning and organizing work through effective project management.

  

Gallo does not sponsor for employment based visas for this position now or in the future.

 **Physical Demands**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Physical Demands


While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to be on his/her feet for long periods of time and frequently bends, stoops and climbs. Required to lift and move cases of product that weighs up to 60 pounds, including lifting overhead.

 **Work Environment**


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Work Environment


The temperature, noise level and cleanliness of the work environment vary with each retail account.

  

This position will be based in the location(s) specified in the job posting and requires working on-site with no telecommuting option. You will be expected to live within a commutable distance.

title: Customer Engagement Manager (US)
description:
Here's your chance to be one of the early employees in a start-up that aspires to dominate the way how global businesses make agreements. Pactum is an AI system that is automatically performing repetitive commercial negotiations on a massive scale. It helps to find optimal contract terms between our clients and their vendors and therefore creates value out of thin air. If you want to be a part of this revolutionary opportunity and work with the largest enterprises in the world, then look no further!


We at Pactum are seeking a highly motivated **Customer Engagement Manager** in the USto join our team. In this role, you will be instrumental in ensuring our Fortune 500 clients realize the full potential of our product. You will be responsible for guiding our clients through the onboarding process and maintaining a strong relationship with them post-implementation to ensure continued success and satisfaction. To deliver excellence in client experiences, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Product Management, Data Science, Engineering, and Operations.


**Responsibilities :**


* **Client success ownership:** Take full responsibility for the success of your clients with Pactum, ensuring they achieve their organizational goals and maximize the product's value.
* **Client relationship management:** Serve as the primary point of contact within the client's organization, working closely with Account Executives to build and maintain strong client relationships.
* **Lifecycle management:** Lead engagements from implementation through the entire customer lifecycle, setting and managing deadlines, assigning responsibilities, and monitoring the progress of initiatives.
* **Engagement and adoption:** Drive product usage and engagement through regular interactions with stakeholders and end-users.
* **Business understanding:** Gain a deep understanding of the client's business, including their procurement tech stack and operational processes.
* **Feedback loop:** Ensure a continuous feedback loop to the Product team to drive improvements and enhancements.
* **Project leadership:** Lead small cross-functional project teams during deployment and live stages, making daily decisions to ensure project success.
* **Reporting:** Prepare and deliver detailed reports on the status of various client initiatives.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with Product Management, Data Science, Engineering, and Operations teams to deliver the best possible negotiation solutions.


**Preferred Qualifications :**


* **Customer success expert:** You have experience in Customer Success roles within SaaS companies offering complex and impactful products.
* **Procurement Industry experience :** You are knowledgeable in procurement, supply chain management, business processes, or finance. Previous experience in negotiating agreements is a plus.
* **Proactive problem-solver:** You excel at identifying challenges and tackling them head-on.
* **Master of organization:** You handle multiple responsibilities with ease and precision and love getting things done.
* **Effective communicator:** You articulate ideas clearly and empathetically, adapting to different environments.
* **Corporate connoisseur:** You have extensive experience working with large enterprises, navigating complex organizational structures, and engaging with stakeholders at all levels.
* **Expert project juggler:** You thrive in dynamic environments, juggling multiple projects at once with great attention to detail.
* **Tech savvy:** You are proficient with technology and eager to learn new tools and systems.
* **Location:** You are based in the US and eligible to work here.
* **Required experience:** You have a minimum of 3-5 years of relevant professional experience.


**Diversity at Pactum**



As part of our ongoing journey towards building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company, we welcome everyone to apply, especially individuals who are underrepresented in tech. We encourage you to apply even if you do not meet all the requirements; all candidates are assessed based on their skills, qualifications, and our business needs. Please don't hesitate to state your pronouns in your application, and let us know if you prefer to be addressed by a name other than the one appearing on your official documents. If you have a disability or special need, feel welcome to inform us, so that we can provide you with appropriate assistance during the application process.


**Compensation details:**



At Pactum, we pay competitive salaries to ensure that our employees know they are valued. We set standard ranges for all of our positions benchmarked against companies in similar stages of growth and revenue, dependent on job function, expertise level, academic achievements, and geographic location. Check out our benefits in our careers page. The total compensation range for this role is $90000/year – $105000/year.

**Why should you join Pactum?**


* We're backed by $55M in funding, including from our customer Maersk and our integration partner Docusign.
* We're on the lookout for outstanding talents. If you're passionate about making an impact in the B2B tech industry and helping evolve a blossoming enterprise into a global leader, Pactum is where you belong.
* Beyond offering a competitive salary, our investor backing underscores our stability and fast-paced growth.
* We believe in a balanced work-life dynamic. To support that, we offer unlimited PTO and flexible working hours.
* At Pactum, we champion a culture that's collaborative, innovative, and inclusive. Every voice is heard, every idea valued, and every team member plays an integral role in our journey.
* To discover our esteemed clients, read about our founders and product, and explore Pactum's presence in the media: check us out at https://pactum.com/


So, what do you say? Ready for the adventure?


*We know that* *imposter syndrome* *and the* *confidence gap* *can hinder spectacular candidates in the job search process. Please consider applying, even if your background and experience don't meet every bullet point in this job post — we'd love to hear from you.*


##### *Please note that all job postings in the United States are fully remote with the option to work anywhere in the continental U.S. unless specified otherwise. For EU positions, please speak with the recruiting team about on-site/remote flexible working options, and opportunity for relocation to Estonia (please find more information here:* *https://www.workinestonia.com/coming-to-estonia/**).*

title: Junior Sales Representative
description:

Gunner is #793 of Inc. 5000 fastest growing private companies and recently, we were named a winner of the Good Housekeeping's 2023 Home Renovation Awards! As such, we're growing exponentially and looking for a Junior Sales Representative to join our team in either Stamford or Cromwell, CT.**  


  

**The sales team at Gunner is a dynamic, tight-knit group that thrives on helping each other hit our company goals! The ideal Entry Level Sales Representative is someone who enjoys a team environment, has a sportsmanship mentality, an impeccable work ethic, and strives to exceed goals.****Are you looking for a company that sees you as a person and not just a number? A company that values what you bring to the table rather than filling a seat?****By prioritizing customer relationships, we create tailored solutions that drive growth and brand recognition.****As a Junior Sales Representative, you will learn how to navigate the field of sales, present solutions to customers, and effectively learn how to close the sale. The best and most impactful way to do this is in person. This allows for the best relationships to be built with the customer.**  


  

As a Junior Sales Representative, you'll be trained on how the Gunner home improvement process works to gain background knowledge on the products offered  

Through individualized training and mentorship, we cultivate a talent centric workforce dedicated to delivering exceptional outcomes for our customers.  

Gunner provides a paid 2 week training as part of our onboarding process!  


  

**What you will do:**  

***COMPANY LEADS PROVIDED***
* Engages with customers in a professional, dynamic manner.
* Operates as the point of contact for assigned customers
* Generates sales among customer accounts
* Answers customer queries and identifies new business opportunities
* Works with the sales team on sales goals and business development needs

**What you will bring:**

* *Outstanding* ***communication*** *and listening skills*
* *Strong* ***Interpersonal skills*** *with the ability to* ***build relationships*** *and establish trust with customers.*
* Must have a **positive** attitude and a **drive** to succeed
* **Self-motivated** and **results oriented** with a passion for sales and exceeding targets.
* The ability to generate ideas , be **creative**

* Path to promotions within Gunner organization

Gunner is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Director, Business Relationship Management & MarTech Products
description:
**Overview /Objective**



The NFL is seeking a dynamic and strategic Director of Business Relationship Management & MarTech Products to lead our Marketing Technology (MarTech) initiatives. The Director will be responsible for aligning MarTech solutions with our organization's strategic goals, driving the evolution of our MarTech solutions, and the adoption of new capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in MarTech and business strategy, possess the ability to take full ownership of initiatives, and demonstrate passion for delivering impactful results. Experience with Adobe Experience Platform (AEP) and other MarTech solutions is essential.


**Key Responsibilities**


**Marketing Technology Leadership & Business Planning:**


* Lead the MarTech transformation to enable fan-centric experiences that deliver fan interactions at operational scale.
* Develop executive-level briefing material and associated analytics to guide program and product decision making.
* Provide subject matter expertise to executive management around MarTech program and product management best practices, with emphasis on trends and impact for the sports and entertainment industry.
* Mentor and share best practices with MarTech delivery resources, including third-party partners.
* Serve as an extended member of stakeholder business teams to ensure ongoing tight collaboration while also bringing business points of view back to cross-functional MarTech leadership.


**Strategy & Execution:**


* Oversee end-to-end product management, resolve issues proactively, collaborate with stakeholders to assess and drive the adoption of new and emerging technologies.
* Develop and implement standardized processes, manage the MarTech budget, and drive operational excellence with a focus on efficiency.
* Build and execute a delivery roadmap and operating model. Lead cross-functional teams, driving delivery of MarTech solutions, ensuring timely delivery of initiatives, Agile planning, and fostering retrospective learnings for future success.
* Create and drive a department/enterprise-wide metrics program to measure effectiveness.
* Develop, in consultation with League and Club stakeholders, as well as MarTech Solutions Architect, an approach to assess the productivity and value impact of new and emerging technologies.


**Required Qualifications**


* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Technology, Business, or a related field.
* 10+ years of professional experience, with 5+ years of MarTech Transformation and Delivery experience or in Product Management.
* 7+ years of experience in product/program management, including managing complex and connected products.
* Proven experience with Real-time Customer Data Platforms (such as Adobe Experience Platform) Marketing orchestration tools (e.g.Adobe Journey Orchestration, Salesforce Marketing Cloud), measurement tools, and other MarTech solutions
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Proficiency in Agile and Waterfall project management methodologies.
* Experience with project management tools such as Smartsheet, Jira, Workfront, or similar platforms.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to work effectively with both technical and business executives.
* Passion for driving results and a proactive approach to problem-solving.


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Experience in the sports and entertainment industry.
* Experience in developing and leading digital transformation processes.
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to develop executive-level briefing materials.
* PMP Certification a plus
* Experience coaching and mentoring teams, with a focus on MarTech best practices.


**Salary / Pay Range**



This job posting contains a pay range, which represents the range of salaries or hourly rates that the NFL believes, in good faith, at the time of this posting that it might be willing to pay for the posted job in the location(s) specified. The NFL expects to hire for this position near the middle of the range. Only in truly rare and exceptional circumstances, where an external candidate has experience, credentials or expertise that far exceed those required or expected for the position, would the NFL consider paying a salary or rate near the higher end of the range.


**Terms / Expected Hours of Work**


* NFL employees are required to work a minimum of 40 hours per week.

*The NFL maintains a Flexible Workplace Policy that provides members of our workforce with opportunities to periodically work from a location of their choice while maintaining a priority on in-person work at an NFL office, which enables us to more effectively collaborate, connect, and build a workplace culture that will drive our continued success.*


*The NFL is committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment that reflects our incredibly diverse fan base. We provide an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all employees and applicants without regard to status as protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.*

title: Account Executive I, Growth Commercial
description:
Job Description:
Rakuten International oversees 7 businesses with over 4,000 employees globally. The brand is recognized for its leadership and innovation in e-commerce, digital content, advertising, entertainment and communications, bringing the joy of discovery and access to more than 1 billion members across the world. Our teams deliver on the company’s mission to delight merchants and customers through innovation, optimism, and teamwork.  

  

Rakuten Rewards is a leading e-commerce company that enhances the way people shop by offering Cash Back, deals and rewards from more than 3,500 merchants. Founded in 1999, Rakuten has grown to become the go-to shopping destination for consumers, having paid out nearly $2 billion in Cash Back to its 15 million members. The company also operates ShopStyle, a leading fashion discovery destination, and Cartera Commerce, a top rewards platform for airlines and banks. For more information, visit www.rakuten.com.  

SUMMARY:
As an Account Executive for the Canadian Rakuten Business, you will use your experience selling digital advertising solutions to large advertisers and their ad agencies in both the US and Canada to successfully grow and scale domestic revenues. Through client-side and agency relationships, a consultative approach and understanding of the digital advertising landscape, you will act as a strategic partner to your assigned merchants and sell a broad range of Ad Media placements and packages that will ensure that their business goals are met. As an individual contributor, you will work closely with the General Manager & Director of Sales and will be supported by the Account Manager and Associate Account Manager.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Maintain and grow current Enterprise accounts, developing broader relationships, gaining customer insights, and meeting annual revenue and growth goals. Partner with the General Manage, & Director of Sales to build strategies targeted to meet both the client' and internal objectives. Possess expertise in mobile solutions, apps and digital commerce. Experience in designing, proposing, selling and overseeing the execution of projects. Demonstrate strong analytic insight and ability to communicate / deliver findings while providing exemplary and timely client service. Has a proven track record of growing ad media revenue of $10M+ annually. Is able to travel in the US and Canada, up to 30% of the year.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS (Knowledge, Skills, Abilities)
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.* 5+ years' experience closing media sales and generating revenue
* Experience working closely with brands and agencies
* Demonstrated ability to consistently close sales and generate revenues
* Strong track record of high-level negotiation and successful internal and external relationship management
* Strong analytical abilities
* Able to work in a fast-paced environment with technical and non-technical teams to translate customer needs into actionable items
* Ability to interact with a broad set of businesses and presenting both over the phone and in person
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong attention to detail, and good follow-through


QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS* Bachelor's Degree or Relevant work experience


Five Principles for Success  

Our worldwide practices describe specific behaviors that make Rakuten unique and united across the world. We expect Rakuten employees to model these 5 Shugi Principles of Success.  

  

Always improve, Always Advance - Only be satisfied with complete success - Kaizen  

Passionately Professional - Take an uncompromising approach to your work and be determined to be the best

title: Director of People and Culture (Healthcare exp highly preferred)
description:
**Company Overview:** At Essen Health Care, we care for that! 

 

As the largest privately held multispecialty medical group in the Bronx, we provide high-quality, compassionate, and accessible medical care to some of the most vulnerable and under-served residents of New York State. Guided by a Population Health model of care, Essen has five integrated clinical divisions offering urgent care, primary care, and specialty services, as well as nursing home staffing and care management. Founded in 1999, our over 20-year commitment has fueled an unwavering dedication toward innovating a better healthcare delivery system. Essen has expanded from a single primary care office to an umbrella organization offering specialties from women’s health to endocrinology, from psychiatry to a vast array of other specialties. All clinical services are offered via telehealth or in-person at over 35 medical offices and at home through the Essen House Calls program. 

 

Essen Health Care is the place Where Care Comes Together! We are looking for the most talented and effective individuals to join our rapidly growing company. With over 1,100 employees and 400+ Practitioners, we care for over 250,000 patients annually in New York City and beyond. From medical providers to administration & operational staff, there is a career here for you. Join our team today!

Job Summary

**Position Title:** Director of People & Culture

**Job Summary:** The Director of People & Culture is responsible for leading the development and execution of human resources and organizational culture strategies of Essen. This role involves driving initiatives related to talent acquisition, employee engagement, performance management, and organizational development to foster a positive and productive workplace environment.

Responsibilities

**Responsibilities include:**

Strategic Leadership:

* Develop and implement human resources and culture strategies that align with the organization's overall goals and objectives.
* Provide strategic advice to the executive team on people-related matters and cultural initiatives.

Employee Engagement:

* Create and maintain programs to enhance employee engagement, satisfaction, and retention.
* Conduct regular employee surveys and analyze feedback to drive improvements in workplace culture and practices.

Organizational Culture:

* Promote and reinforce the company’s values and culture through various initiatives and communications.
* Lead efforts to build a diverse and inclusive workplace by developing policies and programs

Compliance and Policy Management:

* Ensure adherence to employment laws and regulations, and update policies as needed.
* Manage employee relations issues, including conflict resolution, investigations, and disciplinary actions.

HR Operations:

* Responsible for executing HR policies, procedures, and best practices.
* Manage HR budgets and resources effectively.

Leadership and Team Development:

* Lead, mentor, and develop the HR team to ensure high performance and professional growth.
* Foster collaboration and teamwork within the HR department and across the organization.

Qualifications

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field; Master’s degree or HR certification (e.g., SHRM-SCP, SPHR) preferred.
* Minimum of 5-10 years of experience in HR management, with at least 3-5 years in a senior leadership role.
* Proven experience in developing and implementing HR strategies and programs.
* Strong knowledge of employment laws and regulations.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to think strategically and make data-driven decisions.
* Demonstrated experience in managing change and fostering organizational culture.

Equal Opportunity Employer

***Essen Health Care is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we seek candidates who desire to work in and serve an ethnically-diverse population.***

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Ability to Relocate:

* Bronx, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Demo Specialist (Inside Sales)
description:
**Demo Specialist (Inside Sales)**

**Valhalla, NY**

**Monday - Friday, 1st shift**

**OTE $80,000-$90,000 ($25/hr base + commission)**

**About Us:**

Incorporated in 2020, Myriad Systems is an innovative medical software company dedicated to improving payment processing, billing and revenue cycle management. With our flagship product, Myriad Health, we’re breaking barriers and making quality healthcare management accessible to private practices so more patients receive higher quality of treatment. We believe it creates an inclusive ecosystem in which small businesses thrive.

**Job Description:**

As a *Demo Specialist*, you will play a crucial role in driving our sales process by scheduling and conducting compelling product demonstrations of our EHR software. You will be responsible for managing a robust calendar of demos, ensuring that each session is informative, engaging, and tailored to meet the needs of prospective clients. Your goal will be to schedule and complete 4-5 demos per week, with each demo lasting approximately 60 minutes.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Schedule and Conduct Demos:** Proactively schedule and conduct 4-5 virtual product demonstrations per week, showcasing our EHR software’s features, functionalities, and benefits.
* **Engage Prospects:** Develop and maintain a deep understanding of prospects’ needs and pain points. Tailor your presentations to address these needs effectively and persuasively.
* **Product Knowledge:** Maintain up-to-date knowledge of our EHR software, including new features and updates, to provide accurate and relevant information during demos.
* **Customer Relationship Management:** Utilize CRM tools to manage and track demo appointments, follow-ups, and prospect interactions to ensure a seamless sales experience.

**Qualifications and Skills:**

* Minimum of 3 years of experience in a sales role that involved conducting demos, either in-person or virtually. Experience with EHR software or related technology is a plus.
* Demonstrated ability to effectively present and sell software solutions, with a strong track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.
* Proficiency in using CRM software and other client management tools.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Ability to Commute:

* Valhalla, NY (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Behavioral Interventionist (Play-based ABA Therapy)
description:
We are looking to immediately hire a Behavior Interventionist in Warren, NJ and surrounding areas to provide play-based ABA therapy to our families in the home, clinic, or community.

At Cortica, our mission is to design and deliver life-changing care – one child, one family, one community at a time. Ultimately, we envision a world that cultivates the full potential of every child. At Cortica, every team member is instrumental in helping us achieve our mission. Our culture and values guide how we work and treat one another. Cortica celebrates diversity and fosters an inclusive environment, seeking ideas and opinions from everyone on the team.

We are proud of our Company Culture (4.0 rating on indeed), Compensation and Benefits (4.0 rating on indeed), and Job Security and Advancement (3.9 rating on indeed). Our overall rating on Indeed and Glassdoor is 4.0.

***Why Cortica***  
Sign-On Bonus ($250)  
Referral Bonus ($250 - $500)  
Paid Training, Review BCAT Exam & Amazing Onboarding Experience  
Flexible Scheduling  
Paid Drive Time  
Mileage reimbursement  
Medical / Dental / Vision (FT, Part Time 26-29 hours)  
401k (Matching) (FT)  
Continuing Education Reimbursement  
Paid Time Off (FT, PT Time 26-29 hours)  
Continuous Training for Professional Growth (Online Learning System Schoox)  
Supportive Environment (Lead BIs, ABA Assistant Supervisors, ABA Supervisors)  
Advancement w/ internal Career Pathways  
Work with multidisciplinary teams including BCBAs, Speech, OT, MT, LMFTs, LCSWs, Pediatricians, Pediatric Neurologists and Pediatric Neurologist

***What You’ll Do***  
- Provide direct implementation of behavior-analytic services to children with autism spectrum disorder and other neurodevelopmental differences in both 1:1 and group settings  
- Implement positive behavior strategies as developed and analyzed with the Board-Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)  
- Implement strategies with children including antecedent and consequence (reinforcement) strategies, based on developed treatment plans and strategies with their BCBA  
- Work in the home, community, school, clinic or other designated settings with children and their families providing direct behavior-analytic care as determined in the child’s assessment and treatment plan  
- Fulfill all documentation requirements including the use of data collection of strategies and goals, completion of session notes during the session  
- Assist with individualized assessment procedures through preference assessments and data collection

***What You Know***  
- You have experience working with Children ( Child Development, Camp Counselor, Paraprofessional, Behavioral Interventionist, ABA Therapist, Behavior Technician)  
- You love to play  
- You have a High School Diploma / GED or bachelor’s in human services (or related) or Masters  
- You possess a valid Driver’s license (within the state you are working) and reliable transportation  
- You are available in the early and late afternoons (maybe an occasional Saturday)  
- You are currently a Board Certified Autism Technician (BCAT) or are willing to obtain this credential via Cortica’s training program within the first 45 days (will be paid training)

We are not just an ABA company; we are so much more!

***Your Compensation & Benefits***

Cortica cares deeply about the well-being of each team member! The culture and experience we create for our employees are of the utmost importance to us. Among the benefits offered by the company are medical, dental, vision insurance, 401Ks with company matching and rapid vesting, paid holidays and wellness days, life insurance, disability insurance options, tuition reimbursements for professional development and continuing education, and referral bonuses.

The base direct pay range for this opening is **$23.41** to **$31.41** According to your relevant experience, education level, and location, you will receive compensation that fits appropriately within the range. The indirect pay for this role is **$15.00** per hour.

If you have considered a career in mental health (mental health technician), child development, as a social worker (criminal justice), special education consultant/special education, behavioral health (behavior technician/behavior interventionist) then this is a fantastic opportunity for you! Additionally, college students in pursuit of a bachelor’s psychology degree (psychology bachelors) are highly recommended to pursue a position as an ABA therapist to further understand developmental disorders such as Autism. This is just the beginning of the journey for an ABA therapist! We also hope to support those who are interested in becoming a BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst), behavior specialist (behavioral specialist) or Applied Behavioral Analysis Adjunct Faculty. Immediately hiring – let’s team up on our journeys!

EOE. This posting is not meant to be an exhaustive list of the role and its duties. **Please review the job description in the following link: https://bit.ly/3IXd9qT**

#CorticaAM

title: Operations Manager Trainee
location: John F. Kennedy International Airport, NY, US
description:
Here at Avis Budget Group we're more than just rentals—although over 70 years of experience and 11,000 locations in 180 countries has taught us a thing or two about that. We’re shaping the future of the mobility industry with our innovative, customer-focused solutions. Our globally recognized brands - Avis, Budget, Budget Truck and Zipcar - connect people to more. This means more convenience, more options and more time on the road for our customers. But we also connect our employees to more: opportunities, benefits, support, collaboration and most importantly—power to change the future. Sound your speed? Come join our family.


Join Avis Budget Group, a global leader in mobility, as an entry-level Operations Manager Trainee, where you will learn how to lead front-line teams in an exciting airport car rental operation.


Through our structured, hands-on learning program immersed in the operation, we’ll teach you how to increase financial profitability, maximize operational efficiency, improve customer satisfaction and lead teams of people. After completing training, you will supervise one or more of the daily operations and sales functions to ensure maximization of fleet, revenue, customer satisfaction and employee management.


You’ll continue to work closely with managers and mentors who will teach you all of the skills you’ll need to grow and advance your career in our Fortune 500 company, with a clear career path from an entry level Operations Manager all the way to an Area Vice President.


We offer a competitive wage and benefits package: Total potential annual compensation of $58,000 ; Use of a company vehicle which includes gas, insurance and maintenance; access to comprehensive medical plan, 401K and other voluntary group benefits. We also offer employee discounts, including a discounted purchase of a rental car.


We believe in connecting our employees to more: opportunities, benefits, support, collaboration and most importantly - power - to change the future. Sound your speed? Come join our family.  



**What we’re looking for:**

* Recent graduate with bachelor's degree OR associate's degree plus at least two years’ supervisory experience.
* Ability to demonstrate strong leadership capabilities, work well in a team environment with a positive attitude, and make independent decisions.
* Valid driver’s license and good driving record.
* Flexibility to work days, evenings, overnights, weekends, and holidays.
* Willingness to work outdoor in weather conditions with moderate noise level.

**Extra points for this:**

* One year of experience providing high quality customer service

*Avis Budget Group is an equal opportunity employer – M/F/Veterans/Disabled.*

This role requires the ability to frequently stand, sit, walk, drive, and type. This advertisement does not constitute a promise or guarantee of employment. This advertisement describes the general nature and level of this position only. Essential functions and responsibilities may change as business needs require.  



* Use of company vehicle subject to company policy. This position may be with any affiliate of Avis Budget Group.

#POST


Avis Budget Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.


Jamaica
