title: Experienced Insurance Office Manager
description:
#### **Job Description**

**Join Colonial Insurance Agency**, a prominent insurance office deeply rooted in Keyport, New Jersey. We take pride in our longstanding commitment to exceptional service and professional growth within the insurance industry. As a team, we are dedicated to fostering a positive work environment, supporting each other's success, and delivering unmatched results to our valued clients.


We are currently seeking an experienced **Insurance Office Manager** to lead our team in Keyport. In this role, you will oversee daily operations, manage staff, coordinate client interactions, and ensure the smooth functioning of our office. Your leadership will drive our team towards continued success while upholding our standards of excellence and client satisfaction.


If you are a dynamic individual with a passion for management, a keen eye for detail, and a strong commitment to teamwork, **Colonial Insurance Agency** welcomes your application. Take the next step in your career with us!


Salary: $60000.00 - $70000.00 per year

 **Benefits**
Annual Base Salary + Bonus Opportunities


Paid Time Off (PTO)


Health Insurance


Mon-Fri Schedule


Retirement Plan


Evenings Off


Career Growth Opportunities


Hands on Training

 **Responsibilities**  

* Lead and mentor a team of insurance professionals to achieve business objectives and provide exceptional service.
* Business Development: Identify and develop new business opportunities to expand the agency's client base and revenue streams.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and providing customized insurance solutions.
* Ensure the agency operates efficiently and complies with all regulations and industry standards.
* Give full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.


  

**Requirements**  

* **Licensing**: Possess an active New Jersey Property and Casualty License, In-depth knowledge of commercial insurance products, underwriting processes, and industry trends.
* **Experience**: Commercial insurance management. Commercial lines insurance experience is required.
* Strong leadership abilities with a track record of employee management and agency operations..
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact effectively with clients and team members.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to make informed decisions and drive business success.
* Must be familiar with Agency Systems and proficient in Outlook and Microsoft Word.

  

**Company Description**  

Our well-established independent insurance agency is located in Keyport NJ specializing in commercial insurance products. We care about our clients, and it shows in our results as we have achieved many awards since opening our doors. Our dedicated staff works incredibly well as a team and always puts the customer first. Apply to our team today!

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
**About us**

Pet Pantry Warehouse of Wilton CT is seeking Retail Sales Associates to join our team**!**

Pet Pantry Warehouse is a local family owned and operated pet retail company proudly serving 7 locations in Westchester NY and Fairfield CT communities for over 75 years. At Pet Pantry Warehouse we offer the highest quality pet foods and supplies, as well as knowledgeable advice from our extensively trained staff! We look forward to adding new members to join our Pet Consultant team!

***Seasonal or high school applicants will not be considered for this position.*** College students applying must be willing to continue employment after school sessions begin, even if part time only. High School students will not be considered due to their limited schedule availability on weekdays. Seasonal positions do not exist, as our training process is extensive and will not be completed before seasonal periods end.

You will be responsible for selling products, merchandise, and services in a retail setting in order to drive company revenue. Outgoing and energetic personalities who enjoy working with people and pets, and understand the environment of retail sales are a must!  
Opportunity exists to attain full time status and upward promotion within the company. Animal lovers are welcome and preferred!

Starting wages begin at $15.69/hour. However we are open to discuss a higher wage rate based on prior retail experience.

**Retail Sales Associate Responsibilities (including but not limited to):**

* Welcome and identify customer needs
* Explain products and services to customers
* Monitor inventory to ensure product is in stock
* Cashier Duties
* Restocking product/assisting in delivery receiving
* Investigate and resolve customer complaints

* Van deliveries

* Previous experience in sales, customer service, or other related fields
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to build rapport with customers
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to lift 60#
* Flexible schedule-ability to fill morning and evening shifts weekdays and weekends
* Wednesdays, Fridays, and weekend days are required! Please do not apply if you have scheduling restrictions on these days. (Schedule will not be limited to these days.)

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

* Morning shift

title: General Manager
description:
Majesty's Pleasure is changing the way people unwind, connect, indulge and experience beauty services. We are a salon, spa, cocktail bar, cafe, retail space and event space. We are New York's newest and maybe New York's first, Social Beauty Club. Global award winning and coming to New York June 2024!

Overview:

The General Manager of Operations at Majesty’s Pleasure Flatiron is an all encompassing leadership role requiring the coordination of all aspects of spa and hospitality operations at the location including but not limited to resource management, client experience, training and development, standards and excellence, fostering culture and delivering business results through high touch customer service and our unique hospitality approach to beauty services.

The General Manager oversees a group of managers and leads, to ensure the company’s strategy, standards, experience, brand, operational and financial goals are delivered across the spa and hospitality offering.

The General Manager will contribute to the start up, development and growth of a leading beauty services company positioned to become a trailblazer in rethinking the beauty experience all the while, creating a difference in how we take care of staff and take care of guests.

Responsibilities:

* Leadership – leading a team of managers and leads across front of house and services, ensuring culture, strategy, standards and results are delivered, through inspiration, leading by example and with incentive plans and culture;
* Development - coaching, supporting, celebrating achievement across team leads and ensuring proper training deployment across all functions;
* Retention - develop plans to retain staff and guests, the leading indicator of success;
* Communication - articulate, empathetic and concise communications to all staff and stakeholders on pertinent information that may include strategy, policy, culture, celebration, or otherwise;
* Planning - creating plans to deliver individual or team development, store profit, health and safety and customer satisfaction;
* Reporting - providing clear reports and insights to corporate and ownership;
* Presence - maintaining location presence and setting an example for punctuality, professionalism and cultural sensitivity;
* Resources - scheduling human resources and managing the human resource base, accurate ordering of inventory and the care for equipment and venue to ensure exceptional utilization;
* Project Management - coordinate new initiatives, programs, campaigns and offers set by corporate, delivered at the local level;
* Brand Equity - ensure the customer experience, brand standards, brand equity and internal brand is always front and center for going about making decisions; and
* Support - maintain an open door policy with staff and guests to ensure no issue is too big or too small for our attention, care and resolution.

Experience:

* 3+ years of management experience in a hospitality or beauty services environment
* College degree in hospitality or communications preferred
* Basic knowledge of beauty services and industry, passion a must
* Proven ability to deliver operational and financial results
* Proven ability to manage and develop large teams
* A confident individual who is a self-starter who prioritizes and works with empathy & care
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, including to large audiences
* Experience in Front of House operations and customer service / customer recovery
* Ability to offer a flexible schedule based on the demands of the business which may include evenings, weekends and off site events and activations
* A passion for hospitality, unique experiences and the beauty industry
* Proficiency in WORD, EXCEL and POWERPOINT or GOOGLE DOCS
* Shared values in the belief that support and celebration of positive results far outweighs the effectiveness of criticism
* Ability to commute daily or relocate prior to opening of the location

About Majesty’s Pleasure

Majesty’s Pleasure is an award winning spa, salon and cocktail bar located in Canada and expanding into the U.S market with its first flagship location in Flatiron, New York City.

Awarded “Best Manicure in Toronto” in 2023, and awarded Best Spa Concept in the Americas by Hospitality Design Magazine, Majesty’s Pleasure is looking to bring its truly unique customer experience to New York through luxury design, sensory atmospheres, luxury services, a unique hospitality approach, talented artists and estheticians and outstanding leadership.

The company continues to focus on a membership approach, positioning itself as the ultimate social beauty club. We like to say we are redefining what it is to unwind, socialize and experience beauty.

Majesty’s Pleasure has a dedicated influencer and social following. We also work with leading fashion and beauty brands and are known for our unique ability to host private events for PR product launches, private event buyouts, large groups and activations.

Female owned, female managed and female focused, Majesty’s pleasure is an open minded employer creating equal opportunities across all teams and positions.

The company has plans to continue to expand across the New York market as well as across the greater U.S in the coming year(s), furthering growth opportunities for leadership.

Check us out at www.majestyspleasure.com, or on IG @majestyspleasure

title: SETSS Provider
description:
**Special Education/Literacy Teacher - Limitless** **Success inc** **(Queens, NY)**

DATE: 2024-2025 school year  
- **Immediate need for SETSS Provider**

- Recruiting for 2024-2025 school year

- Immediate hire for in-person position

- Only Serious candidates should apply

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Bachelor's or Master’s degree
* Provisional or Permanent NYS Education certificate in Special Education/Literacy
* Ability to work collaboratively and an interest in an interdisciplinary approach to education
* Teachers must be fingerprinted with verification on file with NYC Department of Education

**Note: Individuals who have worked as a full term employee or as long term substitute employee for New York City’s Department of Education within the last 12 months, cannot apply due to conflict of interest laws** .

**JOB DESCRIPTION:**

The Special Education Teacher will consult with and provide support to teachers in addressing the needs of their students with IEPs in the general education classrooms, as well as provide resource room instruction for children whose IEP requires instructional time outside the general education classroom. **RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:**

* Providing resource room instruction to students whose IEPs require instructional time outside the general education classroom
* Providing consultation and support for parents of special needs students in general education classroom and help to facilitate positive collaboration between parents and teachers
* Attending IEPs and staff/parent meetings of students with special needs in general education classrooms, as requested

We have full-time and part-time positions, as well as, after school positions available.

Flexible hours; Monday – Friday.

RETIREES ARE WELCOMED

RATE: $75 per hour - Commensurate with experience

LIMITLESS SUCCESS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY AGENCY AND DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF RACE, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, ETHNIC ORIGIN, SEX, OR DISABILITY.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: From $70.00 per hour

Work Location: Multiple locations

title: Project Manager/Working Foreman
description:
**About Us:** Hollywood Building Services is a reputable construction company specializing in residential and commercial projects. With a commitment to quality and client satisfaction, we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional results while maintaining the highest standards of safety and professionalism. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a dedicated and experienced Working Construction Foreman to join our team and contribute to our success.

**Job Description:** Hollywood Building Services is currently seeking a reliable and skilled Working Construction Foreman to lead our construction teams on various projects. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in working jobs, construction management, and a proven track record of effectively coordinating and supervising construction activities. Technical construction knowledge is essential for success in this role.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work on jobs with staff, coordinating and overseeing daily construction activities, including scheduling, subcontractor management, and quality control.
* Ensure compliance with safety regulations and company policies to maintain a safe work environment.
* Interpret construction plans and specifications and communicate requirements to the construction team.
* Monitor project progress and budget, adjusting as necessary to meet deadlines and financial goals.
* Procure materials and equipment, ensuring they are delivered on time and within budget.
* Provide leadership and direction to construction crew members, motivating them to achieve project goals.
* Utilize hands-on building skills to actively participate in construction tasks and problem-solving on-site.
* Must be able to problem solve and complete jobs in their entirety, ensuring quality workmanship and timely completion.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 10 years of experience in construction, with at least 5 years in a supervisory role.
* Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively manage a diverse team.
* Knowledge of construction methods, materials, and equipment.
* Proficiency in reading blueprints and understanding construction plans and specifications.
* Familiarity with safety regulations and best practices in the construction industry.
* 30 Hour OSHA certification Needed.
* Valid driver's license and reliable transportation.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary based on experience.
* Health insurance.
* Retirement 401K savings plan.
* Paid time off and holidays.
* Opportunities for advancement and professional development.

**How to Apply:** If you are a dedicated and experienced Working Construction Foreman looking to join a dynamic team, please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your qualifications and relevant experience. We look forward to reviewing your application and considering you for this exciting opportunity!

Hollywood Building Services *is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in the workplace.*

title: Cashier
description:
**Position Overview:**


As a FOH (Front of House) Team Member, you'll play a vital role in delivering top-notch service to our valued customers. You’ll treat guests like old friends; warmly welcoming them in, taking care of their every need, and ensuring a positive dining experience. You’ll work as both Cashier and Expediter; answering phones, helping customers with catering orders, packing up orders when they’re ready, and keeping the restaurant clean, stocked, and organized.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide excellent customer service. Ensure that every guest, every time, leaves happier than when they arrived.
* Maintain a clean and organized work area, following safety and sanitation guidelines.
* Handle financial transactions accurately; keep our registers secure.
* Answer customer inquiries about our menu, suggestively upsell our specials and address customer concerns courteously.
* Prepare and assemble orders according to established recipes and procedures.
* Collaborate kindly with your team to ensure a smooth and efficient flow of service.

**Requirements**

* Previous experience in a customer service role in the food industry.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to multitask and work in a team-oriented, fast-paced environment.
* Positive attitude, willingness to learn, and follow instructions diligently.
* Flexibility to work in shifts, including weekends and evenings.

**How to Apply:**


If you're ready to be part of a dynamic team where your contributions are valued and recognized, please submit your application. We can't wait to welcome you aboard!

* Click the Apply Now button and complete your applicant profile with your availability.
* Once your application is reviewed, you may be invited to a phone interview with a member of our Talent Team.
* We'll then run a background check and speak to your professional references.
* Then, you may be invited to an in-person interview with the location manager, who will make the final hiring decisions.
* Please show up for your Interview.


We are an equal-opportunity employer.


Garden Catering makes the BEST chicken nuggets you'll ever have. Founded in 1978, our nuggets have been around since Bruce Springsteen blared on vinyl and disco vibes were in full swing.
  

We’re a quick-serve style restaurant with a full menu of nuggets, wraps, salads and breakfast served all day. Catering is a huge part of our business and in some locations we also offer late night hours. We are a family owned and operated company with 8 locations in CT and NY and more locations on the horizon.  

We believe in family first, community impact, and doing whatever it takes to be of-service to our team and of course, to our guests.


Pay: Starting at $17 / hour

* Health insurance

* 401(k) matching
